jsPsychMonkeys 0.2.5
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Process the parameters_monkeys_minimal parameters so a minimal set of input parameters can be used. Also, tries to take into account dependencies between parameters.

Source: R/set_parameters.R
set_parameters.Rd

Process the parameters_monkeys_minimal parameters so a minimal set of input parameters can be used. Also, tries to take into account dependencies between parameters.

set_parameters(
  parameters_monkeys_minimal = parameters_monkeys_minimal,
  uid = 1,
  browserName = "chrome",
  big_container = FALSE,
  keep_alive = FALSE,
  folder_downloads = NULL,
  DEBUG = FALSE,
  screenshot = FALSE,
  debug_file = FALSE,
  console_logs = FALSE,
  open_VNC = FALSE,
  pid = NULL,
  uid_URL = TRUE,
  local_or_server = NULL,
  local_folder_tasks = NULL,
  server_folder_tasks = NULL,
  disable_web_security = FALSE,
  initial_wait = 2,
  wait_retry = 0.1,
  forced_random_wait = FALSE,
  forced_refresh = FALSE,
  forced_seed = 11
)

Arguments

parameters_monkeys_minimal

A list with the main input parameters. See parameters_monkeys_minimal in _targets.R. If the parameter is entered in this list, use it. You can also enter the parameter directly

uid

User id for the monkey

browserName

In which browser should the monkey run the protocol? c("chrome", "firefox")

big_container

Big containers are needed for big protocols: FALSE / TRUE

keep_alive

Keep the docker container alive after finishing the protocol? This is useful to debug.

folder_downloads

Local folder where csv's will be downloaded:

  • On linux, can be something like ~/Download

  • On windows, can be something like: C:/Users/myusername/Downloads/protocol999 If Monkeys are running OK but no csv's are donwloaded, make sure the docker username has write access to the folder

DEBUG

Show debug messages: FALSE / TRUE

screenshot

Should the monkey's take screenshots of each screen they see?

  • The images will be in outputs/screenshots

debug_file

Store the debug info in a file in outputs/debug

console_logs

Store console logs of browser? Logs are stored in outputs/logs

open_VNC

Show the info to open VNC viewer to see what the monkey's are up to

pid

Protocol id

uid_URL

Include user id in the protocol URL? If true, the uid are predefined

local_or_server

Run the protocol locally or on server c("local", "server) This variable will be inferred from whichever of local_folder_tasks or server_folder_tasks has information. See https://gorkang.github.io/jsPsychR-manual/qmd/04-jsPsychMonkeys.html#launch-monkeys-on-a-server for more information

local_folder_tasks

Local folder where the protocol is stored

server_folder_tasks

Location of the protocol in the server

disable_web_security

Run with CORS disabled? Needed for local protocols that load videos: FALSE / TRUE

initial_wait

Initial wait (in seconds) after entering the main protol page, before the monkeys start to complete the protocol. If the protocol has lots of images to pre-load should be a number big enough for them to download.

wait_retry

How many seconds to wait before retrying, after no elements are found in a page.

forced_random_wait

At some random point in the protocol, the monkey should wait for a random period of time? FALSE / TRUE

forced_refresh

Force a full refresh for some of the monkeys? This is useful to test if the monkey's can continue a protocol after they exit.

forced_seed

Random seed

Value

a list of parameters for the rest of the jsPsychMonkeys functions

Examples


set_parameters(parameters_monkeys = list(uid = 888, uid_URL = TRUE, forced_seed = 11, 
                                       local_folder_tasks = "~/Downloads/protocol999", 
                                       screenshot = FALSE, forced_refresh = FALSE, 
                                       debug = TRUE, open_VNC = TRUE))
#> Warning: cannot open file 'R/main_parameters.R': No such file or directory
#> Error in file(filename, "r", encoding = encoding): cannot open the connection
